thread.title: Warwick grad superb in return to mid-Hudson
thread.title_full: Warwick grad superb in return to mid-Hudson

author: Ken McMillan Times Herald-Record
title: Warwick grad superb in return to mid-Hudson
text: Posted Oct. 11, 2015 at 7:49 PM By Ken McMillan Posted Oct. 11, 2015 at 7:49 PM » Social News It was a great homecoming for Warwick’s Alexis Archilla on Friday. The Warwick graduate and junior for No. 14 SUNY Plattsburgh scored all five goals in a win at SUNY New Paltz, making him a sure-fire bet to take SUNYAC men’s soccer player of the week honors this week. Archilla has a league-leading 13 goals and one assist, ranking first with 1.93 points per game. The Cardinals are 11-1-2 and 3-0-2 in the SUNY Athletic Conference. Wallkill’s Tyler Lundgren (SUNY New Paltz) ranks seventh in the SUNYAC with 1.31 points per game. He has six goals and five assists for the Hawks (9-5, 3-3 SUNYAC). Highland’s Joe Dolan (Mount Saint Mary) has started all 14 matches as a freshman defender and has logged the most minutes (1,160) for the Knights (4-9-1). Women’s soccer Minisink Valley grad Alex Gallagher (Misericordia) has twice been named the Freedom Conference offensive player of the week. The sophomore has eight goals and 21 points. She had two goals in back-to-back games against Arcadia and Lebanon Valley, and has three matches with at least four points. Gallagher was also named the Misericordia athlete of the month for September. Misericordia is 10-2-1, 2-0 Freedom and ranked 14th in the nation. Newburgh’s Victoria Colotti (Buffalo State) ranks sixth in the SUNYAC with two-game winning goals, against Case Western and SUNY Fredonia. Colotti was a third-team all-SUNYAC pick in 2014. The Bengals are 10-3, 5-0 SUNYAC. Mount Saint Mary’s Mary Riley (Newburgh resident), Bridget McKeever (Wallkill) and Destiny Ribadeneyra (Valley Central) have logged the most minutes for the Knights (9-5-10. Ribadeneyra has four assists. Riley owns a 1.12 goals-against average. Women’s volleyball Monroe-Woodbury’s Amanda Hunton (Wentworth) leads her team with 345 assists, or 5.23 per game, ranking eighth in the Commonwealth Coast Conference. Wentworth won two matches Saturday to improve to 7-13. Field hockey Onteora’s Hayley Kim leads No. 19 SUNY New Paltz (10-3, 3-1 SUNYAC) with seven assists, to go with one goal. She has started all 13 matches. Rondout Valley’s Jillian Eggers has four relief appearances. Rondout Valley’s Meg Redmond and Victoria Ospina play for SUNY Cortland (9-3, 4-0 SUNYAC). Redmond has started all 12 matches, posting a goal and two assists. Ospina has three starts and eight appearances. Kingston’s Emily Beck has 10 relief appearances and one assist for SUNY Oneonta (4-7, 2-2 SUNYAC). Kingston’s Colleen Keegan-Twombly leads Ithaca (8-3, 4-1 Empire 8) in goals (10) and points (21), tying for the conference-points lead. She has scored in her last three matches (and six overall), and posted a hat trick against Wells last Wednesday. Kingston’s MaryKate Siegel has a goal in three relief appearances. Football Monroe-Woodbury’s Chandler Williams , a defensive back, and Joe Loyacono , a lineman, have six tackles apiece and Brandon Lewis has eight stops in six games for SUNY Cortland (5-1, 3-1). Newburgh’s Jay McAllister has two catches, one for a score. Monticello’s Anthony Gray has 11 catches for 127 yards and one touchdown for SUNY Morrisville (2-3). Washingtonville’s Dennis Scherrer has three grabs for 21 yards and a score. Liberty’s Edwin Soto has 32 carries for 244 yards and three touchdowns. Kingston’s Wallace Stephens ranks fourth on the team with 34 tackles and has 2 ½ sacks. Warwick’s John Garcia (Hartwick) has completed 52 percent of his passes (102-for-198) for 1,719 yards and 13 touchdowns. The senior averages 344 passing yards. He passed for 433 yards in the opener against Western Connecticut and 440 in last week’s loss vs. SUNY Cortland. Brad Garcia is tied for the team lead with 36 receptions for 653 yards (131 per game) and eight touchdowns. Kingston’s Korey Jubie has two field goals and 19 extra points. Washingtonville’s Tito Pichardo leads the team with 288 rushing yards on 51 carries, with one touchdown. Hartwick is 2-3, having lost all three Empire 8 contests in a row. Kingston’s Zack Chilcott (SUNY Maritime) has completed 40 percent of his throws (31-for-77) with four interceptions and two scores. Cross country New Paltz’s David Busby and Tri-Valley’s Jim Bernstein have been top-five team scorers for SUNY Oneonta in the last three meets. New Paltz’s Alfredo Mazzuca (SUNY Geneseo) placed fourth at the recent Mike Woods Invitational. Geneseo was ranked No. 8 nationally. Warwick’s Deirdre Davis (SUNY Oneonta) finished second in the SUNY Delhi Weekday 5K on Thursday. Sullivan West’s April Ackermann has been a top-five team scorer for No. 14 SUNY Oneonta. She recently placed fourth at the SUNY Plattsburgh Cardinal Invitational. kmcmillan@th-record.com
